on slavery NEW YORK- Award-winning historian Eric Foner has received a new honor, the Abraham Lincoln Prize, for his biography about the 16th president's views on slavery. Eric Foner will receive$ 50,000 for The Fiery Trial: Abraham Lincoln and American Slavery. He is best known for "Reconstruction," published in 1988 and winner of the Bancroft Prize.
